entry.title: Re: Two different subtotals for a Rebate condition contract
entry.content:
Hi @HariBoyapati2 

Option 1:
You use 2 sets of rebate conditions. Within customizing you configure that both base values are transferred into the settlement document. This would look like this:

Within the pricing procedure and the condition contract you need 2 rebate conditions. One is using condition REBV as base value, the other is using condition ZRBV as base value.

Option 2: 
You deal with this in the CDS view for the business volume table. Prerequisite: Static logic that is the same for all condition contracts.
I had once the issue that different pricing procedures were involved. These pricing procedures used different subtotals. We used some logic in the CDS view to fix this:

cast( case
when base.kalsm = 'DUMMY' then base.gross_value
when base.kalsm = 'YU1300' then base.bonba
when base.kalsm = 'YU1304' then base.netwr
else base.bonba
end as ZSD_CCS_BONBA ) as bonba,

entry.title: Re: Two different subtotals for a Rebate condition contract
entry.content:
Hi @HariBoyapati2, 

It's not standard to have more than 1 subtotal used per contract based on material type or other. 
Regarding the amount field group split, I would recommend to try it in dev/sandbox environment to see the impact (as any configuration in CCM or other module, you get experience by experimenting and hands on). 

In the meantime, here is the description provided by SAP for Group of Split criteria used for Total amount as per Split:

Controls which split criteria the system applies to determine the amount for the Target Condition Type for Total Amount as per Split Criteria and for the Target Condition Type Total Amount as per Split, Second Side.
Use
The purpose of this group of split criteria is to reduce the number of required customizing objects (profiles for business volume determination and condition contract types) in case that you want to use different split criteria for the determination of the total amount as per split criteria.
The control involves three steps.
‚Ä¢ You define groups of split criteria used for total amounts as per split.
‚Ä¢ In the Amount Fields - Split Criteria dialog structure of a profile for business volume determination you assign different split criteria to a group of split criteria in connection with the target condition types for the total amount as per split criteria on the primary and second side of the settlement document.
‚Ä¢ When you create a new condition contract for a condition contract type that uses the contemplated profile, you specify the split criteria group on the Settlement Data tab page of the condition contract header.
Conclusion: In the settlement run for this condition contract, the system uses those split criteria for the determination of the total amount as per split criteria which you have assigned to the split criteria group specified in the condition contract header.

For your requirement, you could check to capture the correct subtotal directly in 1 fields (e.g. For Material type ABC, KZWI1 = KZWI1, for Material type BCD KZWI1 = KZWI2) in the CDS view used for the profile of business volume. 
However, here are some warnings if you plan to do that: 

  • Logic for subtotal determination should be defined and stable (not per contract created, e.g. customer 1 = logic A and customer 2 = logic B). 
  • You're not posting accrual in the transactional documents, if not the system may calculate Accrual based on Subtotal 1 but for this item it should be based on Subtotal 2. 
  • Audit: You should be able to explain clearly how it's calculated for any Audit control/request. Please check with Audit team prior.

Option 1 provided by @MichaelWerner can be another option but may required some tricks in the pricing procedure + more maintenance in the condition record side within the contract - depend heavily on the requirements.  

Regards, 
Gauthier VICTOR

entry.title: Re: Introducing the Gantt Chart Custom Widget for SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello @AEG ,

In your case, the technical IDs are IGCPREXID, IGCPREXID__IGCPLEDDT, IGCPREXID__IGCPLSTDT, and IGCPREXID__IGCRPPHAS. Since you are working only with dates, the Gantt Chart should work without any issues.

The Dataset Parsing Settings mapping should be configured as follows:

  • Event ID: IGCPREXID.id

  • Event Name: IGCPREXID.description

  • Event Description (optional): IGCPREXID.description

  • Event Start Time: IGCPREXID__IGCPLSTDT.id

  • Event End Time: IGCPREXID__IGCPLEDDT.id

  • Parent ID (optional): IGCPREXID__IGCRPPHAS.id

    • Use this only if you need a hierarchical representation and the field references the parent project ID.

    • If a hierarchy is not required, keep the default value Parent_ID.

  • Color of Event Bar (optional): Color

    • Leave this as the default value, since there is no color information in your model.

@andreasja_schneider, many thanks for your inputs.

entry.title: Re: Multiple payment method for one open AP
entry.content:
Good day @ChinYeeChia 

Thank you for your question

In the public cloud one payment document can only have one payment method. That means in your case you cannot clear 30,000 by bank transfer and 70,000 by BoE within the same clearing transaction. So, the best practice is for you to use two separate payment documents, each with its own payment method, both clearing the same invoice. See below link on supplier invoice creation: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/01060a2e758f4e8a9d4a7cf07b0ce323.html?locale=en-US and posting General Journal Entries: https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0fa84c9d9c634132b7c4abb9ffdd8f06/950f8054747b053de10000000a441470.html?locale=en-US

My recommendation on how to pay one invoice with bank transfer & BoE, is to:

  • Post a partial 30,000 USD payment with the ‚Äúbank transfer‚Äù method, and
  • Clear the remaining 70,000 USD with a BoE document by using the BoE Process.

Both will ensure you fully clear the same supplier invoice, and each carries its own payment method.

Step 1: In your manual payment app, enter your bank account, company code, currency and payment method for the bank transfer.

Then select the supplier and then your open invoice of 100,000 USD. Enter 30,000 USD payment amount and post document

This will partially clear the invoice with the bank transfer payment method. The remaining open amount on the invoice is now 70,000 USD.

Step 2: Use your BoE process/app (this will depend on the country you have activated or your BoE scope) to create a bill of Exchange and reference the same supplier invoice.

  • Reference the vendor and the particular invoice
  • Enter 70,000 USD as the amount to be cleared
  • Choose BoE as payment method and post the BoE document

This will clear the remaining 70,000 UD on the invoice. You will then have both amounts split accordingly.

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP Fieldglass Sandbox Environment Refresh: 5 Tips for Success
entry.content:
Refreshing your sandbox environment with current production data keeps testing, troubleshooting, and training accurate and realistic. But there are important considerations and data privacy safeguards you need to know before scheduling a refresh. Here are 5 tips to help ensure your sandbox environment refreshes are smooth, timely, and successful.

1. Know Your Refresh Limits

Your sandbox edition determines how many refreshes you can request each year and the maximum data slice you can include in each refresh.

 

Edition

Annual Refresh Limit per Sandbox

Maximum Data Slice

Base Edition

Up to 2 refreshes annually

6 months of Production data (can be less)

Premium Edition

Up to 4 refreshes annually

1 year of Production data

(can be less)

Learn more about base and premium sandbox environments on the SAP Help Portal.

2. Provide 30 Days‚Äô Notice

All production data refresh requests must be scheduled via SAP for Me at least 30 days in advance of your desired refresh date. This lead time ensures resources are available and helps avoid delays to your project or testing cycles.

3. Plan Your Timing Strategically

With limited annual refreshes, align them with your highest priorities, such as:

  • Before major product releases or integration testing
  • Ahead of critical training sessions
  • After significant business process changes or migrations

4. Follow Post-Refresh Best Practices

Once the environment refresh is complete:

  • Validate critical data, configurations, and integrations
  • Reapply sandbox-only settings (for example, test user roles, custom scripts)
  • Notify your team when the environment is ready for use

5. Understand Data Anonymization

To protect personal and confidential information, certain PII fields are anonymized during every sandbox refresh, including in customer-paid sandboxes. This includes the following fields:

  • Email
  • Address
  • Phone number
  • LinkedIn profile URL
  • Resume name
  • Ariba Network ID (ANID) for Supplier and Buyer

It is also important to note, the following PII fields are not anonymized in the sandbox environments, including customer-paid sandboxes, by default. However, you can request SAP Fieldglass Support to anonymize these fields by submitting a case via SAP for Me or the SAP Fieldglass Help Center:

  • First Name
  • Last Name
  • Display Name
  • Company Name
  • Company Street Address

Make sure to check out the SAP Help Portal to learn more about data security.

In summary, using these quick reminders will help you get the most out of your sandbox refreshes. With thoughtful scheduling and clear post-refresh checks, you can ensure your sandbox is accurate, secure, and ready to support your most critical initiatives without wasting any time.

Don‚Äôt forget to explore the SAP Help Portal for more information on the SAP Fieldglass Sandbox Environment Landscape.

entry.title: SAC Story Bookmark. Unable to save a bookmark.
entry.content:
Issue with bookmarks. Unable to save bookmark error message. 
In log (Developer Tools) a message appears: We can‚Äôt have another bookmark with the name ‚Ä¶ in this target resource. 

There are no bookmarks in the story self however. 

Reason was in the Bookmarks version which was changed, what caused all old bookmarks to be invalidated, but not deleted. Means the bookmarks are still in the background, but not visible for the user in the Story self.

Go to Story \ Bookmarks, choose Invalid bookmarks and delete.

entry.title: Re: Show parchment icon in sm37
entry.content: In short, NO, you cannot link a spool request to SM37 if it's not generated by the executable program defined as the step of the job (any ABAP code inside the initial Internal Session). STARTING NEW TASK runs in a different Internal/External/User session.
